intro: Cyphostemma jatrophoides, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and woody stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to elongated, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its roots are fibrous and used in traditional medicine. Cyphostemma jatrophoides is often found in rocky areas and can thrive in arid conditions.
